title: We Think All Indian Women Need This Hilarious App That Sends "Craaazy Texts" To Creepy Men
text:
facebook 120 SHARES 
In light of the recent Bengaluru incident, women need to have agency more than ever – to slam offenders, fiercely fight back abuse and protect their rights. Despite seasonal uproars over rape, abuse, and a slew of other assaults on the female gender, the culture of disregarding woman thrives. The Internet is one such enabler where men, sitting on their pile of entitlement, attack women. Women are branded for having so much as an opinion. While the “others” folder on our Facebook overflows with consent-dismissing men, our dating apps mirror a starkly similar reality. Well, the app BOY BYE BOT, has come forth to deal with all the creepiness. 
Inspired by Beyonce’s song, Sorry, that featured the now-famous slang “Boy Bye” as a savage response to cheating men (and toxic relationships), the app operates hilariously. Here’s how it works – when a woman finds herself in a situation where a man refuses to step down from asking for her number, or fails to decipher the word “NO”, she needs to hand out the number 1-626-466-3293 (1-626-GOODBYE) as her own. Of course, they are bound to hit the number with a barrage of messages. What they will receive, instead, are messages that BOY BYE BOT describes as "craaazy texts" and links to feminist articles. Here’s are screenshots of the app built by comedian Hassan S. Ali - 
Sadly, this app isn’t accessible in India, yet. Will someone take all our money, and get this much-needed app to our sanskaari homeland already?
